author: protolambda
content:
https://github.com/ethereum/rayonism

We opened this repo to aggregate the many rayonism resources, and host the testnet configs in. I included an example configuration for the first devnet.

With the updated eth2-genesis tooling (https://github.com/protolambda/eth2-testnet-genesis), we can now prepare a BeaconState `genesis.ssz` ready for a post-merge testnet start (including eth1 state root, empty deposit tree, validator allocaiton, etc. preparation). This SSZ file is for the very latest merge beacon spec (will merge tomorrow in eth2 specs repo). Now we have to focus on client readiness (implement prototype RPC), and we can possibly try a small shared merge devnet next week!

Office hour call in 25 min

author: protolambda
content: Open office hour call now (discord, rayonism-calls channel). If you can't make it to the other calls due to timezones, this is your opportunity to get in sync with the latest merge work.

author: ajsutton

author: protolambda
content: discord in web browser can be difficult with mic. Click allow in browser, and then again in the mic icon (expanding menu)

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> My neighbourhood is without power :( Saving whatâ€™s left of my phone battery.

author: protolambda
content:
Was a short office hour for Teku updates, <@!361447803194441738> if you do have any questions later, we can maybe cover them during the merge implementers call, or chat. This time for a call is not as well attended as the others, we may reschedule the one of next week.
Regarding the next devnet; take a look at the configuration and try the genesis tool for local-devnets. We will focus on RPC and latest minor spec changes (incl some SSZ encoding tests) now, and then devnet shortly after, when the first clients are ready.

author: m.kalinin
content: **Note**: I've added a `timestamp` to the result of `consensus_assembledBlock` method to keep all fields of `ExecutionPayload` that is being returned. This is for conformance with `consensus_newBlock` which accepts `ExecutionPayload`.
